problem.para: What is \span\Set{ \Vect{b} } in geometrical terms?

solution.para: The vectors of \span\Set{ \Vect{b} } are of the form t\cdot (0,-3), with t\in\RNr arbitrary. Therefore all of these vectors will have 0 in their first coordinate. Further, if y\in\RNr is arbitrary, choosing t:=-y/3 gives (0,y) = t\cdot \Vect{b}. Therefore \span\Set{ \Vect{b} } is the y-axis of \RNr[2].
